{{cpp/string/char_traits/title|length}}
{{cpp/string/char_traits/navbar}}
{{ddcl|notes={{mark constexpr since c++17}}|
static std::size_t length( const char_type* s );
}}

Returns the length of the character sequence pointed to by {{c|s}}, that is, the position of the terminating null character ({{c|char_type()}}).

See {{named req|CharTraits}} for the general requirements on character traits for {{tt|X::length}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|s|pointer to a character sequence to return length of}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The length of character sequence pointed to by {{c|s}}.

===Complexity===
Linear.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

void print(const char* str)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::quoted(str) &lt;&lt; " has length = "
              &lt;&lt; std::char_traits&lt;char&gt;::length(str) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}

int main()
{
    print("foo");
    
    std::string s{"booo"};
    print(s.c_str());
}
|output=
"foo" has length = 3
"booo" has length = 4
}}
